newsitem.title: USA: Primark to buy Bowne unit.
newsitem.headline: Primark to buy Bowne unit.

text.p: Primark Corp., an information technology provider, said Wednesday it will buy Baseline Financial Services from Bowne & Co. and the company's founder, Robert Patterson, for $40 million in cash.
Patterson will continue to manage Baseline under a long-term employment contract, Primark said.
Baseline provides financial information on more than 7,000 U.S. companies to investment managers at more than 450 client companies in North America, mostly institutional portfolio managers.
Waltham, Mass.-based Primark plans to integrate its data products with those of Baseline.
The deal is expected to close within 30 days, it said.
Primark's stock rose 37.5 cents to $26.375 early on the New York Stock Exchange. Bowne edged down 25 cents to $23.75 on the American Stock Exchange.
